Peddler's Village, a small town located in
and near
holds 75 years of history.  It is a wonderful place to go if you want to spend a day or a weekend shopping, dining, and lodging.'

The best way to get into Peddler's Village, if from Pennsylvania, is to drive.  However, if you decide to fly, plan to arrive at the Philadelphia International Airport and take the train to Willow Grove.

Take the New Jersey Turnpike to Newark Airport Exit to Route 78 West to Route 287 South to Somerville. 
Get on Route 202 South, and Peddler's Village is located at the intersection of Route 202 and Street Road.

Take 95 South to Pennsylvania. Get off at Exit 51--New Hope. 
Turn right onto Taylorsville Road. Follow Taylorsville Road to Route 32 North. 
Turn left onto Route 32 North and follow to New Hope. 
Make a left at the first traffic light onto Bridge Street (this is also Route 179 South). 
Continue straight on Route 179 South to Route 202 South. Turn left onto 202 South and follow to Street Road.

Take Route 476 to the PA Turnpike toward New Jersey. 
Get off at Exit 343--Willow Grove.  
Stay to the right after the toll onto 611 North. 
Turn right at the light at Street Road.
Make left on Route 263 North.
Bear left to Route 263 North to Peddler's Village.

Once arriving in Peddler's Village, the best way to get around is on foot.  If you are driving, there is a parking lot to park your car, free of charge.  Everything is located in a close proximity and in walking distance.
From September 10, 2007 to Sunday, October 28, 2007, be sure to see the

.  Admission is free, and you will get the chance to see some of the best and creative scarecrow presentations.

Also see the
on November 16, 2007. This is Peddler's Village lighting ceremony, which marks the beginning of the holiday season. The lights will be turned on at 6:15PM, so don't miss it!

Year-round, there is much more to do than see at Peddler's Village.  There are many stores to shop in, restaurants to dine and drink in, and a lodge to relax and sleep in.

Also, if the boutiques aren't enough for you, don't miss out on the Penn's Purchase Outlet Mall located conveniently across the street from Peddler's Village!
Peddler's Village offers over 70 shops.  From art and culture to fashion to home decor, each shop meets the needs and wants of its guests.

From casual to upscale, a guest visiting Peddler's Village has a broad choice of dining selections.

value: , 215-794-4000. The village staple for 45 Years, the Cock 'n Bull has been serving traditional American dishes like steaks, seafood, and even the classic Chicken Pot Pie. An all-you-can-eat buffet of beef and seafood is featured on Thursdays.  A Sunday brunch buffet is offered every Sunday morning from 9:30AM-2PM, and Sunday dinner ends at 9PM. M-Sa 11AM-10PM.

to enjoy sophisticated steak and seafood.  With live jazz music on weekends, enjoy your experience of consuming some of the finest dishes. Lunch is not served on Sunday, but from Monday through Saturday lunch is served from 11am to 4pm.  Dinner hours also vary. From Monday through Thursday, you can enjoy dinner between the hours of 3pm and 10pm. On Fridays and Saturdays, dinner runs from 4pm to 11pm.  Sunday dinner hours are 1pm to 9pm.

The contact telephone number for this event is 215-794-4000.

Most of Peddler's Village's dining facilities offer Children's Menus.

value: ,Route 202 & Street Road, Lahaska, 215-794-4004. Has 70 rooms, and helps a guest to satisfy his or her relaxation needs.  Many of the rooms have fireplaces and spa-like bathtubs.  Upon arrival to your room, you will be presented with champagne and a snack basket. The Peddler's Village might have only one place to rest your head, but it is cozy and also created to have an 18th century style.
